comments.author: benoit@flama.fr
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1) AppleWebKit/534.30 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/12.0.742.60 Safari/534.30
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

Hello,

I am representing a very large company using Google Apps.
I have reported an issue to Google Enterprise support concerning a bug when creating a new document in Google Docs. this issue is only happening in Firefox. Google answers that they were able to fix it withj new Chrome release but of course not in Firefox.
When I create a new google document in Firefox, the focus is not set on the document. So when I start typing on my keyboard, nothing happens. I need to click on the document before it works.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Create a new Google document (text document), docs.google.com
2.Wait until everything is well loaded
3.Start typing with the keyboard
4. Nothing happens
5. click in the document
6. Type with the keyboard : it's ok

Actual Results:  
No focus in the document

Expected Results:  
Focus in the document

I have a video and a HttpWatch file with this test that reproduces the issue

comments.creator: simona.marcu@softvision.com
comments.raw_text:
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110523 Firefox/6.0a1

I can confirm on Windows XP that even if the page is on focus, nothing happens when typing (until clicking on the document) using the following STR:
1. Go to docs.google.com
2. Create a new document (Create new -> Document)
3. After everything is loaded start typing with the keyboard
4. Create a new document and after everything is loaded start typing with the keyboard.
comments.text:

2. Create a new document (Create new -> Document)
3. After everything is loaded start typing with the keyboard
4. Create a new document and after everything is loaded start typing with the keyboard.
